title: Scholarship
content: What's the difference between MRD and CNR?  MRD is 40% of tuition fees how much is CNR?

comments.body:
[https://pes.edu/scholarships/](https://pes.edu/scholarships/) 

MRD for top 20%(SGPA) and CNR for top 2%(SGPA).

MRD is 40% of tuition fee for (x+2) semester(assuming you are in x semester), each semester is half your college fee(excluding the exam fee and stuff). Similarly CNR is 50% of (x+2) semester fee.
Is the scholarship only for one semester?
No it's semester wise for all the semesters
If someone gets into top20% for a single time , he'll get scholarship for all the remaining semesters?
No every sem you have to come in top 20 of the class to get scholarship for that sem
what is DAC scholarship ? how much do they give under that ?
2% of your section/stream or whole batch comprising all department students?

1st year your cycle (phy/chem)  
2nd year onwards your department.
